intro: Antennaria umbrinella, commonly known as the shadowy mouse-eared cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are hairy and lobed, adapted to thrive in rocky and shaded environments. Antennaria umbrinella is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
